Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a hotel..DO NOT GO THERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jockwood77
Reviews.Content: I usually listen to reviews but on occasions give them the benifit of the doubt....This time I wished I had listened to them. Ok where to start...We arrived at 16.30hrs & First impressions not too bad. On entering the hotel Builders were wandering around everywhere so not a great start. On entering room it is VERY small but clean & all downhill from here.....It states tea/coffee facilities in room but there were none & no where to even put it. The bed is a cheap flimsy uncomfortable argos/Ikea metal frame with rubbish mattress & wafer thin pillows. On requesting more pillows I was told that there are only 2 allocated per room so we could'nt have anymore. Moments later the banging & drilling started from below. The hotel is still being converted & 2 floors are only open. This noise contiuned on till around 18.30hrs & started again the next morning at 07.30hrs. On complaining the staff did'nt seem to care & shrugged it off...BREAKFAST: Continental breakfast contained of tea/coffeee/juice, COLD STALE toast & COLD croissants. I requested some fresh warm toast which was met with a dissaproving look & slight hostility, So we left the hotel to eat breafast on both days elsewhere. We actually spent as much time out of the hotel as possible to avoid the noise and lack of space. This should be advertised as: 1 STAR BACKPACKERS HOSTEL OR a 2 STAR GUEST ACCOMODATION...NOT A HOTEL!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's Really Not THAT Bad”
Reviews.Author: colo_mtn_surfer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights before heading to Paris. Reading the reviews after I booked I was nervous. Reading the recent reviews well after my trip make me think the people who rate this hotle so poorly are used to the Ritz. Granted this hotel is very minimal. You carry your own bags up the stairs since there is no elevator. The staff seems to be Russian so of course they come across rude (really they're not). The rooms are small, but you're really there to sleep. If you're spending all your time in your room you don't know how to travel. Get out and see the sights. I found the room to be a perfect size, and the bed was fine. The bathroom was a bit cramped but it's the European standard. The location of this place is awesome, just a short walk to Hyde Park and even a shorter walk to the Tube. If you travel with my mindset "the hotel is for sleeping, spend the extra money on activities" then this place is fine. The only real negative thing I could say about this hotel is the wifi is a bit spotty. Other than that this place is just fine if you’re not expecting the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “terrible.... in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: emma c
Reviews.Content: Greated by no one! We had to wait for 1/2 hour to actually check in no one was around then greated by a very unfriendly uncoprative male, whom i found challenging and unhelpful!!! terrible customer sevice!! given a tiny room which when opening smelt of toilets and when went into the bathroom i found that the toilet had not been flushed!! my partner then decided to have a shower and guess what no hot water so down 4 flights of stairs back to NO ONE on reception!!! waited for about 20 mins and then the unhelpful receptionist/manager was extrealy rude.. when i asked him about the water he said you have to do this and that i said no you show us what to do this all took over 3 hours!!! we then demanded and i mean demanded our money back.... Terrible i have never been treated disrispectfully like this before... no customer service the only good thing to say about this place is the location is great but the rest has been an unsatisfacory stay and if you are greated by people that don't give you the sense of respect then they im affraid loose....

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Chella27
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently and boy were we disappointed! We read the trip advisor comments after we booked (big mistake). The room was SO small and the bathroom was a joke! The shower head sprayed water everywhere and the mirror in the bedroom was broken and taped back together! The staff are not friendly at all and at one stage the receptionist was on her cellphone most of the time. We stayed at another hotel for Â£25.00 less afterwards and it was amazing and so much better. There are a lot of nice places you can stay for ALOT less!! I will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room and good price”
Reviews.Author: sydkhan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 week and can't stress it enough perfect location, clean room and friendly staff. Bayswater is only 2 min walk. Recommend it....

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel which is fine for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Caryne
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading the other reviews here but I have no idea what they were expecting for a budget hotel in Bayswater as my husband and I found the place perfectly acceptable. Firstly, it is not hard to find, exit Bayswater Tube, turn left, cross the road and it's a doorway next to 'Bella Italia', took us about two minutes to get there from the Tube. The reception is on the first floor and there are stairs (so no good for those in wheelchairs but thats what you expect from this type of place). The receptionist was perfectly amicable, said please and thank you so I can't say I need anything else. Both the reception area and stairway was clean and tidy and well lit. Ok, the place isn't the Ritz but in hotels you get what you pay for and, if you book online and don't pay the 'walk-in' rate (who does pay the 'walk-in' rate at a hotel these days???) then you get get a double room with breakfast for less than Â£40.00 (we paid Â£38). The breakfast is fairly basic, croissants, applles, yoghurt, cereals and toast (which is pre-cooked in a basket but I asked the staff member to toast me some fresh which she did so it wasn't cold). There are jams and cheese as a choice for your toast. Also tea, coffee and juice. I'm not saying any of it is the best quality but, once again, as good as you get somewhere like Holiday Inn Express and better than Travelodge/Premier Inn where you get nothing unless you pay extra. The room is small but perfectly adequate, ours had two small bedside tables (one not next to the bed as there wasn't the room but at the foot of the bed) a full length wardrobe with two more drawers underneath and a small table with a kettle, cups, tea, coffee etc. All clean and perectfly serviceable. There was also air conditioning and a hair dryer (we used neither but both looked fairly new). There was a small TV up on the wall which had the main channels and worked fine. The shower room is tiny, there is no getting away from it but it was clean and we had plenty of hot water (those complaining of there being no hot water must have little patience as it did take about a minute to heat up). If we were really fat we might have had problems there but my husband is 6 foot and 14 stone (around 200 pounrds) and he managed it fine so shouldn't be a problem for most people. We slept well all night, at the front of the building with the window open and had no problem with noise but guess it could be worse at the weekend. Ok, the room was a bit chipped around the paintwork and it wsan't brand new and shiny but I've stayed in fair worse 'chain' hotels and paid a lot more so all I can say is use your head, you get what you pay for and this place is fine for those looking for cheap, convenient, basic accommodation in London.

Reviews.Title: “I give bad places a fair go, I'm going to slam this joint down!”
Reviews.Author: tsubs
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason I stayed here is because I needed to rush home so I got my flight agent back at home to book me a flight and she booked this accomodation for me. Regardless if I stayed or not I had to pay as it was booked on my agents credit card. when I travel I always check trip advisor and always advise everyone else to. Reading some other comments its good to see it wasnt just me having a shocking experience. When i got off the train from the AP I asked people which direction, no one ever has heard of this place, I asked shops in the same street and no one knew its location or existance, i got in 3 taxi's and they didnt know, the train station 100meters away didnt even know. like wow this place must be the place to go! after about 2 or 3 hours of walking around with my luggage I finnaly found this joint, a small doorway with a tiny sign of the hotel wedged between 2 restraunts. Nothing "Royal" about this place and its not even next to or near hyde park where you think it would be. Lets get to the staff. when I got to reception I was greeted with a filthy look as in why are you here. She was no help and just wanted your money (200 pounds for 2 nights in a tiny room which wasnt 100% clean either) rude, arrogant, good for nothing waste of space receptionist who looked as if she would be happier dead. as I said I give people and places a fair go even if the place is horrible. Its prob not worth talking about this place anymore. So anyone reading this, theres better places out there but if you go there its your own fault. REMEMBER rude staff, location thats hard to find and expensive!

Reviews.Title: “If you looking for good vacation Donâ€™t stay donâ€™t spend any money time for this place”
Reviews.Author: Reed-JP
Reviews.Content: Travel Europe total 18 days 4 country this is first country visit stay First of JULY 2011 2 nits booking from Net Booking.com We pick this place lesson many nice comment from guest reviews also location is near famous Hyde Park Big mistake chose this place shame this hotel business name The ROYAL HIDE PARK HOTEL Donâ€™t trust photo and detail sound like a good value. Reasonable price for this location I paid almost $ 200 for night It is a scam From guest reviews room is deep clean and fresh why you said that Room is small no place to bring luggage only bed, dirty wall ceiling, very smelly room like a pee from toilet, set up old poor towel no face cloth. not hot water for shower. very dirty trash can. Very poor lighting dark room. Hotel the smell of mildew, very thin wall and doors hear from outside many guest room office People walking. very loud. so many guest room for Small building Not friendly not personality guy work front desk, this is Room for rent kind of place but can not charge this amount. if you looking for good vacation big recommend Donâ€™t stay donâ€™t spend any time for this place

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean.”
Reviews.Author: rinn
Reviews.Content: While there's nothing fancy about the Royal Hyde Park Hotel, I enjoyed my stay there. I'm the type of traveler that only needs a room to sleep and shower, having a few requirement: cleanliness, good location, inexpensive. The hotel room was very small (which is typical of many European hotels), but it included two single beds, over-the-bed lights, two small wardrobes, an electric tea pot, a tv, a bedside table, a full length mirror, an AC, & a tiny bathroom with a shower, toliet, and sink en suite. The linens were changed daily, and new towels provided. Everything was very clean. At check-in the staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a place to lock your luggage up if you arrive before check-in. There's a small room for breakfast as well. The only downside to the hotel was there is no elevator and three long flights of stairs with 50lbs bags is quite a trek. The location of the hotel provides easy access to the tube (both Bayswater & Queensway), and is close to Paddington Station as well. It's near several restaurants, shops, a small Tesco (groceries), and Hyde Park. Grab a sandwich and drink from Pret A Manger and head down to Hyde Park for a nice picnic while watching people strolling through the park or playing football. Overall, the hotel was a great no-frills place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Claire-from-Stoke
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a weekend in London to see Hard Rock Calling. We booked this hotel with out checking feedback on Trip Advisor... WHAT A MISTAKE THAT WAS !!!!!! We did lok on here the night before we travelled and when we read the feedback we were dreading going. We were hoping that it was not as bad as everybody said but we were wrong. The location is good but that is it. On arrival we were greeted by the receptionist who just said "Â£148 please" there was no pleasantries of any way shape or form. When we "squeezed" into our room there was a single douvet on a double bed (appropriate as the room was obviously meant to be a single room), I went to tell reception and she did not believe me until she had come and checked herself. There were coffee stains down the wall where the kettle was and as for the bathroom..........the grout in the shower was all stained with orange mould the tiles were broken and a health and safety accident waiting to happen. The tiles that were not broken had just been placed on the floor and were not stuck down and never had been as there was no adhesive on them at all. Breakfast was a few croissants and toast, there was a sink and washing up area in the "restaurant" a bit like a cafe. We asked for an Iron and ironing boad but they only had an iron so we had to iron on the bed.... Do not go !!!!! pay extra for somewhere clean and habitable !!!! If you want somewhere grotty and small with rude staff who do not speak very good English then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean but in desperate need of repair”
Reviews.Author: Chil1976
Reviews.Content: I stupidly read the reviews on Trip Advisor after booking this hotel and after I was already within the cancellation period! The entrance to the hotel was very easy to miss, but thanks to a comment from another reviewer we found this easily. The receptionist was friendly and quickly located our booking despite the computer system being down. The room itself was on the second floor and was small but as we were only staying one night, it was OK for our purposes especially as it had an en-suite shower. The definition 'newly refurbished' on the website I think referred to the new wardrobe, kettle, beds, shelving, TV, shower, sink and shower base but the actual decor and condition of the room and bathroom was in very poor condition i.e. I could barely see out of the window (dirty exterior), mouldy walls behind the wardrobe, peeling paint in the shower, stained and rusty looking tiles, scuffed walls and electrics hanging off the wall. This is a very old building which is in great need of TLC. Having said that, the room was clean, bed comfortable and shower powerful and hot but I would not recommend this hotel if you are planning more than one night or want somewhere you can spend a bit of time as the rooms are not a pleasant place to spend an extensive amount of time and there are no leisure areas to relax. The hotel was however in a very good location, in easy access of two underground stations and walking distance from lovely gardens and shops. There was a small amount of tea, coffee, sugar and milk provided in the room and clean bath towels (one each), soap and a small sachet of shower gel. The breakfast was very dissapointing. The breakfast room like the bedrooms has new tables and chairs but poor attention to maintenance. Tea, coffee and fruit juice provided but foodwise only cold, very slightly toasted bread along with jam sachets, butter sachets and wrapped cheese portions. If you are on a budget and just want somewhere to lay your head then this may be a suitable hotel for you, if you want anything more, wait and try for a secret hotel with late rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Hostel not hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceanlass
Reviews.Content: Never ever come here, if you are expecting a hotel. We paid excessive prices because of the Royal Wedding but even the lastmintue.com prices of sometimes as little as Â£29 are expensive for this awful place. The good; the shower works and is hot. The bedding is clean. The bad; noisy, unkept. Our double room is so small that you can not open the door until you move your case out of the way first. The forth floor the rooms are sooo small that get no floor space or tea making facilities, but the help staff say that you are welcome to walk the four flights of stairs make tea in the kitchens and take it back to your room!!!!! I am an experienced traveller/camper and happy to rough it.... This is a hostel and should be hostel prices only.

Reviews.Title: “Why this place is not prosecuted for misrepresentation remains a mystery”
Reviews.Author: morris30
Reviews.Content: In one word 'Awful.' A dreadful experience including facilities that were downright dangerous, a defective shower, appalling decor and non functioning t.v. All this presided over by a rude and disinterested desk clerk. Do not believe anything in their brochure!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with small rooms and reasonably good location”
Reviews.Author: wallaceje
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very near the Bayswater tube station, which not a bad location, but not near any of the big sites. I thought it was overpriced for the size of the rooms. And the hall ways and exterior were quite old and could use a good deep clean and fresh coat of paint.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrkasssssssssssss
Reviews.Content: I have booked the hotel and made a call on the same day of reservation about my cancellation of the room. As my friend has emergency that we cannot go to London, the staff also promised me that they won't charge me any. I even reconfirmed it on the next day! However, today I found my credit card bill that they charged me first night room charge!!!! I called there and they even denied they received my call!!!!!! I am so angry about the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: stupid7361
Reviews.Content: How very dare this company use the name ROYAL, believe me nothing ROYAL about this pit. Newly furbished, when? 15 years ago. Everything about this establishment is poor, the rooms have seen better days and the management have no controll over the NO smoking policy. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “HELL-HOLE”
Reviews.Author: AoifeVL
Reviews.Content: If you value your health do not stay here. I was checked in by a rude receptionist & told my room was on the 4th floor (there is no lift). While I was unpacking I found a raw fish on top of the wardrobe! The receptionist gave me another room. I left the hotel and returned at about half ten. I opened the door to the bathroom & found cockroaches all over the floor! I went straight down to the receptionist who got her manager who was one of the rudest men I've ever met. He came up to the room with a can of bug spray (so it's obviously a common occurance) & proceeded to spray about half the toxic cemicals in my presence. He told me that there was no other rooms available. I demanded a refund & left. It was now midnight & I was out on the street with my luggage, exhausted and scared with nowhere to stay. I went around the corner to the lovely people in the Hilton Hyde Park hotel who took pity on me upon hearing my story and gave me a room at half price. I don't know what I would have done without them as on that particular night every hotel in the city seemed to be booked out. Take my advice it's not worth the cheap room rate go somewhere with an established good reputation & if the budget will stretch you won't do better than the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hostel, not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelbranigan
Reviews.Content: Awful, never seen anything like it in my life. Staff very rude. Dirty entrance, rooms so tiny you could not swing a cat in them. Shower fell off the wall, receptionist offered us another room to take a shower but we had to walk up 5 floors to do so. Did not have any breakfast as it was not a very clean place. Kettle in room was rusted inside so could not even have a cuppa. My partner could not shave in the sink as the mirror was in the way and the sink was the size of a cup. Definately not very good value for money. On leaving and expressing my unhappiness with the whole shambles of a hostel, i was given an email address to complain and told that they would get back to me. I have now emailed twice and not even so much of an apology. DISGUSTING!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price range.”
Reviews.Author: wstraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few nights and for me it was better than i expected based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. The room was small, but clean. The bathroom was small but clean. The free internet was a big surprise. And the breakfast was better than i expected. The hotel isn't the latest in design and lacks an elevator but what do you expect in this price range in an old victorian building? The hotel offered good value for money for me because i am an active traveller and used a lot of public transport seeing the sights of London - which was good because there are two underground stations on different lines on the same street. The hotel worked as a good base to rest while getting to know the city.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous bathroom, unhygenic plumbing”
Reviews.Author: endilwen
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location, right across from Bayswater station. Lots of restaurants, fast food places, a big cinema and shops all on the road. Great for accessing central London. Aircon was a great extra as room got very stuffy. Negatives: Bathroom step was dangerously high, my friend came out of the shower, slipped and whacked her back on the step; is now covered in bruises. The plumbing left a LOT to be desired; the shower filled up after 5 minutes of use and did not drain for about 30 minutes. We also woke up to a horrible smell and found that other people's dirty shower water was coming up through our drains. Our toilet didn't flush very well and the sink also filled up. I pulled the blind down and the whole thing came off the roll to reveal that it was stuck down with a couple of plasters. We had a lot of luggage and were horrified to find that for a hotel in London there was no lift, and the stairs weren't exactly straight up and down - we were put on the third floor. The receptionist demanded payment on arrival and was fairly rude and unfriendly (though the Russian receptionist was warm and friendly!)

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scrubnut
Reviews.Content: Visited at end of June 2010. Room very basic with mould on walls and chipped plasterwork around the windows. There were cockroaches in the shower, and the paint was peeling off the walls. This was an allegedly 'recently refurbished' hotel. RUBBISH!!!! The staff were rude and unhelpful, and the noise - UNBELIEVABLE!! You could even hear the light switch been switched on in the next room. For Â£99 per night I would expect a better quality of room. I would never advise anyone to book into here - unless they were homeless!!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst "hotel" ever!”
Reviews.Author: GoldiLocks061
Reviews.Content: I spent with a friend of mine three nights at this place which is rated as 3 star hotel. In my opinion, it should be rated as a hostel. Hotel? How? Why? Not possible. We got the first room next to reception. The curtain was placed down (and broken somehow) so we were basicly in a dark room for three days. It was EXTREMELY noicy. Some of the lights didn't work. We had a double room but the beds were so near to each other that it almost felt like sleeping in the same bed. There was almost no space for luggage. The floor was DIRTY. If you wanted to take a shower you had to wait 10 minutes to get warm water. Sometimes it still didn't come and you had to shake in the extremely freezing water. The whole staff was Eastern European and EXTREMELY rude. Even when I said Hallo" or "Good morning" they turned their heads and didn't answer anything. Breakfast meant dry toasts and croissants which were made warm in some microwave oven, running out all the time. Then some instant coffee (!) with almost cold water because there is just one water boiler which is running out of water all the time. The only good thing was the location which is perfect. The price was ok but hig compared to the sufferings we experienced there. I would definitely NOT go there again and would not recommend it to anyone. In case you don't want to suffer from bad service, small rooms, broken things, dirtyness etc., etc., don't just go there. Next time I'll pay a bit more and go to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: irmalaboule
Reviews.Content: When I found the website of this hotel, I thought I had found a really good bargain. It was cheap, well located, it seemed cleaned and quite modern. and the breakfast was included in the price. My first impression when we arrived was quite ok. The room was clean, modest but friendly. It was not luxury, but it was fine. The problem came when we went to sleep. There was absolutely no isolation. We heard the ventilation outside, the corridor, the stairs, the rooms upstairs, on the side and below... Between the late arrivals and the early birds, we barely slept. A nightmare! And when we went for breakfast, there was only toasted slices of bread with a bit of butter that the waitress was putting 5 by 5 on the counter. So you had to be quick to get something to eat. So, don't go there! it's not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: ShellBee_1
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were being booked in to the hotel by the most miserable rude receptionist ive have ever met when another guest came to the counter it was 1.55 but he wasnt allowed to book in til 2 she threw his papers back at him and told him to go away!! We got to our triple room and it was tiny there was nowhere to put the cases, everything was rotting away and we were on the top floor and there was no lift so we had to drag our cases all the way to the top. The room smelt of onion and garlic because of a dodgy window that didnt shut properly so the smell was coming from the restaurant next door. Would seriously never ever recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SriBkk
Reviews.Content: Actually, Iâ€™ve already read some of the reviews about the hotel here but it was the only hotel which offered the lowest price (76 GBP) at the time of our traveling. The twin room was so small and the bed was very small as small as for Asian size only. I was afraid that I might fall down; fortunately, I survived after 4 days of staying. The only good thing for this hotel was the shower with good mix of warm water which I was worried before when I read some of the reviews that the hotel didnâ€™t have hot water. So if anyone is looking for a good hotel at the same price, I would recommend Westpoint Hotel where it is near Paddington Tube Station. (--)

Reviews.Title: “London Royal Hyde Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: golddigger1957
Reviews.Content: Having a couple of free days decided to go to London. See the museums and explore the capital. Searched for a well situated, reasonble price hotel with breakfast included and this hotel is perfect. (Book on late rooms .com and save pounds.) We booked a double room but we had a double and a single bed in our room. (So the room was larger) Had an ensuite, T.V., Coffee making facilities, air conditioning and the room was same as in the pictures. Breakfast was 7.30-9am. Self service - we got there at eight o'clock and the counter was being topped up all the time with hot toast. Use Bayswater underground - by Keningston Park - walking distance of all attractions. Lots of transport links & Food places. I did not see alift so please check before booking if one is required. Go in September and Museums are free entry.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a very cheap price”
Reviews.Author: ziachecca
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews about this hotel I was quite worried...actually I've been quite positively surprised. Good value for money. Amazing location. Room was OK and quite clean. AC was terrific, sometimes even too cold! They were doing some renovation works when I stayed there and I think the place will be slightly improved, but unfortunately there is no lift. Breakfast wasn't great (and too early in the morning!), but considered the cheap price, this ain't important. I got charged two times the first night by mistake, but the receptionist has provided me a refund very efficiently and honestly. Good hotel if you are with friends and plan to hang out a lot, enjoying London night life.

Reviews.Title: “worse ever”
Reviews.Author: alibaba99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a triple room in June 2009. The room was so small, the cases wouldn't even fit into it. The lights didn't work and the remotes for the tv and air conditioner were missing. This was easily the worse hotel I have ever stayed in when I've been in London.......give it a big miss!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluevolta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of May 2009. Reception up 2 flights of stairs. Left luggage behind a curtain in reception while we went out for the day. Returned about 8.00 pm and went to the room to change for the night. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. Bathroom is a bit on the small side, but for the price it was ok. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment. Great location - right on Queensway and Hyde Park 5 minutes walk away. I have stayed in worse hotels in London. Good value. Staff friendly. If you want the Ritz, pay the Ritz's price! Admitedly, it was a lads weekend- so we were not overly fussy. Overall 3 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Truely awful - dont do it! Please read”
Reviews.Author: foleymj
Reviews.Content: I would NOT put a dog in this hotel. The beds were a joke. Myself and my freind were practically sleeping in the same bed the room was so small. The mattress was so narrow you could not roll over in the bed. The duvet was so short it didnt reach past my knees. One flat pillow! We could barely get into the bathroom it was so small. We came home after a night at dinner and low and behold there was a stream of water coming down through the celing in the bathroom. The girl who works there brought us a cereal bowl and 2 towels to sort this out. She dindt even offer to change our room! The water flowed all night and we had to take everything off the floor - what a disaster! When i went to complain the next morning the girl tried to get rid of me till the other guests had finished breakfast but I would not go. I had to get my money back for the rest of my stay and spent the first half of my second day walking around looking for another hotel. The best part of the hotel was leaving it! DO NOT stay there unless you really dont care. Bad rooms - rude, unprofessional staff and just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Grim!”
Reviews.Author: Mystical-Smurfette
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we found that the main bedroom light didn't work, neither did one of the bedside lights, so we only had the one bedside light to see with and the one in the bathroom (although I'd rather not have been able to see the bathroom clearly!). We complained about this and were told it'd be fixed the following day. The following day we returned to find that the main light had been fixed, but not the bedside light - okay, no big deal, at least the main light works! I went to the bathroom and low and behold, that light now no longer works! Do you think maybe they just switched the bulbs around?! So off we went to complain again, only to be told there was nothing they could do (the handyman was unavailable it seems!) and we were offered a small desk lamp to plug in and shine into the bathroom! Anyway, we come back the following day to find that yet again it still hasn't been fixed! You have to imagine the smallest bathroom in the world ever, basically you bend down to sit on the toilet and you bang your head off the sink! So to say it was very dark in there, is an understatement (oh and they donâ€™t even provide soap to wash your hands with after going to the toilet â€“ surely a basic requirement!) So we had rubbish lights throughout the stay, this doesn't include the fact that it didn't appear as though the bathroom had ever been cleaned (they obviously haven't heard of Dettol Mould and Mildew remover!) and the shower leaked all over the place! When I say leaked, I mean leaked, you could have taken a bath in it or better still a swim, had the place been bigger!! Also the pictures on the website make it look really nice, fresh and clean, well this might have been the case when it was first refurbished and opened, but certainly not anymore! It was dirty, grim and disgusting and in need of one hell of a major spring clean! Oh and another point to mention, when you pay a cheap cowboy builder to do your work for you, you get just that - a shoddy cowboy finish!! It looked like Stevie Wonder had been allowed to renovate and decorate the place! Anyway, I digress! On the final morning, I went to take a shower, only to find that there's no hot water! This is at 7:30am, after a long, hot sweaty run through Hyde Park, So I NEED a shower! If you're thinking why not just have a wash in the sink, believe me you can hardly clean your teeth in the sink, let alone any other parts of your body! So off I go downstairs in my towel, to once again complain (are you seeing a pattern here?!) and the girl comes upstairs and asks have I run it for long enough?! I've run it for 10 minutes, tried turning it off and on, up and down every other thing you can think of and it's still freezing cold! Her solution, try turning the tap on in the sink (Hmmmâ€¦.Now thereâ€™s a permanent solution for you!). So I have a little bit of a lukewarm shower, before the sink starts to nearly flood and my Mum has to turn the tap off, which then results in freezing cold water again! The only plus point was that this was the only time it happened, but after a weekend of rubbish, it was the final straw! Oh and when they mention breakfast, I wouldn't get too excited (toast which is thinner than a piece of paper, the hardest, driest croissants in the world and the worst waitress ever â€“ talk about a face like a smacked bottom!), and would actually recommend going to Tesco's along the road! The staff were all Polish, however (apart from one of them, who didn't speak much English and wasn't very helpful - why work in an English hotel, if you don't speak English?!) I found them nice and as helpful as they can be when working in the Polish equivalent of Fawlty Towers in London!!!! The only thing it had going for it, was that it was next to Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park, my favourite parts of London, hence choosing it, so I could go running every morning, but I'm afraid that is its only positive point! Would I stay there again - NEVER - Not even if you paid me and I had the best room in the house - if they even have such a thing! So if you are still reading at this point and I'll be surprised if anybody is - Please just spend a few pennies more and go somewhere else, because I wouldn't let my dead dog stay in this sad excuse for a grotty hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Harrifish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night the night before an interview in London. After reading all the other reviews (after booking my room, which cost peanuts compared to other London hotels) I was very worried about what I would find, but also kept an open mind as some people seem to expect the world when they pay little. I was more than pleasantly surprised. Efficient check in with friendly staff, easy to get the wireless internet connected (for a small charge of Â£3). The hotel is on a main street so you have to expect some traffic noise if your room is on the street side (mine was, the noise didn't bother me). Room was clean & contained all I need from a hotel room. It's amazing to get an en-suite room for such little cost! Bed was comfy. TV in room. Also breakfast was included in cost. Normal hotel breakfast that's just as good as at other chain hotels. I will definitely use this hotel again, for both business and pleasure trips. And will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Awful.”
Reviews.Author: lemonairepaides
Reviews.Content: My company booked me for a stay in this hotel and I had an awful week. I had to change room due to my employer skimping and I really paid the price both in staying at this hotel and after the room change. The first room wasn't too awful, however the mattress had springs popping out of it and one spring had a plaster wrapped around it! A huge health risk. Shocking. The kettle was disgusting as someone had put coffee granules directly into the kettle, this hadn't been cleaned in some time. The second room was tiny, extremely dirty and the shower fixtures were broken. Avoid at all costs, the dining area and reception are a front for the horrors that lie within.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: HondaVTR
Reviews.Content: It is on a very busy street, full of food places i.e. McD, KFC etc etc. The hotel entrance is set between a noodle bar and Bella Italia and is open at all times. You can walk up the stairs and into the corridors unseen and unchallenged. I asked for my room key at the end of day one by number and was not asked my name, could have asked for any and accessed any room? I checked in with a mouse!! It was wandering around the reception area which is very close to the breakfast area. The staff were mostly friendly. My room was ok, plenty of room, comfy bed, clean bedding etc. TV and drinks facilities. Very cheap coffee - take your own!!! The room was pretty quiet though, bit of air con drone but it was easy to shut out. The shower room was adequate. It was so close to being a gem - finish the decorating where things had been moved on the wall, sort the gaps out in the flooring an clean the room and it would have been ok. There was an empty shower gel on top of the shower door for my two nights - not mine!! There was toothpaste all down the front of the sink - not mine!! The dado rails etc were a bit furry! My coffee cups were not changed so the dregs sat in the cup for over two days. Breakfast was ok. Toast or croissants, fruit juice etc. I was worried though as I'd seen the mouse wandering around this area. Wouldn't stay again unless they change the cleaners!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_B52
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was the prime reason for booking, as I was with friends & going to Notting Hill Carnival, however this turned out to be the only good thing about this hotel! On entering the very small (box sized) room, I was hit by the smell of damp mould, as I am asthmatic within 10 minutes of being in the room I had to leave. The smell came from the phone-box sized bathroom. I went to see the on duty receptionist who told me there were no other rooms, after a very firm talk I was taken to see another room which was exactly the same, with an additional large, dark, damp patch on the wall & ceiling. I explained I was asthmatic, and the damp would effect me badly; after much insistance I was shown a third room on the fourth floor that had a newer bathroom, without the damp smell which I accepted. There are no lifts in the hotel, definately not for the elderly or disabled. I had no hot water for the entire duration of my 3 night stay, and my room were not cleaned either. The room was over priced, the inclusive breakfast not worth getting up for and bearing in mind the numerous problems encountered I highly reccommend avoiding this hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: fourth_time_lucky
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews a day prior to staying at the Royal Hyde Park I was considerably worried about what I had let myself and my friends in for. We had booked a triple room for two nights via lastminute.com for Â£30 each per night, so obviously we weren't expecting five star quality, although neither were we expecting a dump. Nevertheless, such fears were completely unfounded. On arrival and whenever we spoke to them the staff were friendly and helpful. Perhaps this was because we always said hello and greeted them with smiles too - treat those as you want to be treated! The room itself was exactly the same as the photo on the website - clean floors, clean towels (replaced each morning) and sheets, and enough space to manoeuvre in. The bathroom was clean, the shower was powerful and warm. Granted it was all quite small, but one can't expect more for such little money. The only niggle we had was if we all used the loo in succession, when it would back up a little before subsiding again, but this really wasn't a problem. We also had no problems with noise at night, despite staying there the weekend of the Notting Hill Carnival! I will admit that this could be because we were on the third floor facing away from the street, but this is proof that there are quiet rooms in the hotel. The continental breakfast was very nice with a considerable selection for such a low-priced hotel. As for cold croissants and toast, I cannot argue that there was such a basket on the counter; however there was always a fresh batch being cooked and if you asked for one of the warm ones they would happily give you one. If you don't ask you don't get! Coupled with the excellent location two minutes from Bayswater tube station, I would say that the Royal Hyde Park Hotel exceeded my expectations and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: daytripper1888
Reviews.Content: Paid 99 pounds for an extremely small room for one night. The en-suite bathroom was the smallest Iâ€™ve ever seen; the toilet was nearly under the sink! The entrance door is sandwiched between two shops facing an Ann Summers on Queensway you would nearly miss it (pity we didnâ€™t). The stairwell to reception is stained and dirty, which does not give a good impression. The receptionist wasnâ€™t friendly and the interior needs drastic attention. The breakfast area didnâ€™t look too clean so we decided to skip it. The room was very small and very noisy and therefore depressing. Although we werenâ€™t planning to stay in the room for long, just five minutes was enough to sully our stay in London. All in all I would advise anyone NOT to stay in this dump. Stayed in a Premier Inn at London Bridge for a tenner less the next night and the difference was astonishing.

Reviews.Title: “nothing royal... all are dirt”
Reviews.Author: mixtureem
Reviews.Content: i booked for 2 nights. when i arrive i cancelled the other night. pics on the website are tricky. a full of racism staff. it was really a nightmare to me. i feel frighten all the night. very noisy area. i went to berjaya eden. it is realy good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish”
Reviews.Author: gabore
Reviews.Content: booked through lastminute.com. paid Â£94 for a tiny, shabby room. the staff in the dirty no-window'd breakfast room were rude and unhelpful. i expect a lot more for the money. i wont be staying there again and i suggest you dont either.

Reviews.Title: “Jeckyll & Hyde hotel”
Reviews.Author: nathalie1976
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a lovely stay in London NOT due to this horrible hotel experience. We were already afraid that this might happen because we read the reviews, but we had already booked this hotel prior to reading the reviews and we hoped for the best. It's quite central, that's true, but the room was dirty, smelly, noisy and the staff didn't quite speak English. On top of all we didn't have hot (or even warm) water for two days (and we were only there for two days). It was not because of the good service but me and our big mouths that we managed to get a refund of 40 percent!! Overall, I would definitely not recomment anyone this horrid hotel unless you like any of the things mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Michelle from Halifax”
Reviews.Author: MichHalifax
Reviews.Content: II was dreading staying at this hotel having read the reviews after I had booked, however I was pleasantly surprised :) Okay - it wasn't the Hilton but then I didn't pay that sort of price for it. The room was basic but spotlessly clean; bedding was crisp white and clean; amenities of TV, kettle and ensuite were ample; towels changed daily; continental breakfast was fine; it was close to tubes, bars and plenty of restaurants. I don't know what some people expect for their money but this was fine if you want a cheap and chearful place to use as a base whilst sight-seeing around London. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wished i'd read the reviews”
Reviews.Author: scullyEssex
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if you have taken leave of your senses. Because you'll have none left on leaving. Our eyes streamed through the smell of mothballs. We suffered hyperthermia due to there being no hot water. You needed to take elevenses as the breakfast was so insubstantial. You needed oxygen to reach your room on the top floor, your eyes poked out so as not to glimpse the horror of decoration. Need i continue ?

Reviews.Title: “a real disgrace”
Reviews.Author: jjf_8
Reviews.Content: Royal Hyde Park Hotel just doesn't deserve the label "hotel". If this place has ***-rating, the UK has really poor standards. At the arrival, an extra fee of Â£50 had to be paid. The room itself was really terrible. Smallest hotel room I have ever seen, a disguisting smell, television and most of the lights didn't work, the beds were too small for any adult person and not clean, and worse of all: uncovered electrical wires everywhere, which is pretty dangerous. You could barely move in the badroom. Wanna turn your stay in London into a nightmare? Stay in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siggie66
Reviews.Content: This would rate as the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We booked after the reviews of 2006 seemed ok for budget 3 star hotels for a week in London. They must have changed owners as this hotel is simply awful. The description and reality are completely different and it boarders on fraud. The rooms are are just a bit bigger than a double bed, the central heating does not work, there is zero or intermittent hot water at low pressure. The air-con to make do instead of broken central heating is jammed above a wardrode and vibrated and made about as much noise as a jet on take-off. If we could have found another hotel we would have moved, but that was impossible in London at Christmas, so we were stuck there. There is no value equation here. We paid nearly one thousand pounds for two rooms for a week in a 3star budget hotel, what we got was a week in a half-star gulag. We got clean towels every day and that was it. Our rooms were never made up or the linen changed, we even had to go to the so-called " reception" to ask repeatedly for loo paper. The rooms were dusty and only swept where you could see the floor. Breakfast was toast. cornflakes and croissants mildly heated in a microwave by the unhappy eastern european staff. I guess they were unhappy because they had to spend all day at the hotel, at least we could escape. The only, I repeat only thing of any worth at this dive is that it is close to the tube, so you don't have to go far to get out of the place. To sum up - do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: moPooleDorset
Reviews.Content: Travelled from Poole after a hard week looking forward to a 3 star hotel at a cost of 100 pound per night through last minute, more than we have ever paid before. A door off the main High Street up two flights of steep stairs - no sign of Georgian space. He is over 6 foot 5! We asked to see the room - up two more flights seeing worn and torn carpets, cables hanging down and ridiculously narrow corridors. the room was so small with a dirty old blind and window. How did any builder allow this conversion. Who paid who? We were shown another bigger room with a new blind - it was no bigger but we were told we would be liable for the payment so! Miserable feeling ripped off we hoped for breakfast. A grim croissant and instant coffee in a plastic cup, cheap corn flakes in a tupperware box. We complained but everyone just shrugged, we were given an e-mail. I felt so awful as a group of Spanish holiday makers eat white toast that must have given such a dreadful impression of hospitality. The heating came out of the air-conditioning and made a noise so couldn't sleep with it on. Thin duvet- waking up to a dirty shower with occasional hot water. I want to know how the hotel was awarded 3 stars it shouldn't be given 1.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: astria57
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but beding was clean staff was very hard to understand Shower was broken the bathroom was so small there was no room to swing a cat. We did not get hot water till about 10 oclock at night after every one had stoped using it When we went down for breakfast the next morning we had to sit and wait till there was a table and what a wait just for a small cup of coffee and cold toast .We went out for the day we came back to the bed as we had left it The cups we had made a cup of coffee in in the morning had just been left we did expect some clean ones and at least the bed made we will never stay there again I was so looking fowared to my few days in london but the hotel spoilt it

Reviews.Title: “not what it looks like on the web”
Reviews.Author: lizdrew
Reviews.Content: Royal Hyde Park Hotel London. W O W .We booked and paid for three nights,this is really a one night at a push Hostel boasting as a Hotel.We went down the first morning for breakfast this was a first to the small counter for your toast if any was ready you had to take your cup and it was filled with tea or coffee at the counter if the person behind it was not in the sink full of dirty dishes the so called kitchen behind the counter was a microwave toaster and kettle.The geust leaving through the night had to drag there case down the narrow flights of stairs which could be herd in most rooms,Beds were quickly made some time during the day and a young chap wandered around dabbing paint in most areas also dripping the paint on hall carpets and room floors and never cleaned up.This should not be classed as a Hotel we feel Expedia has not been aware of the accomodationas we have used Epedia before and always enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but very basic”
Reviews.Author: Clare28
Reviews.Content: I went with my eyes open to what I might expect having read some reviews before booking, and the hotel lived up to expectations. Good price but small room with the most basic of facilities provided e.g. one towel, one small soap, one pillow and one mug but no glass to drink from. The air conditioning worked and was a blessing as it was a hot night and my room on the top floor was very warm. If you opened the window you could hear the loud noise from the street below all night, so it was best not to have to do that. The best things are that it is close to the Bayswater Tube, there are good restaurants and bars nearby, the decor is modern and I thought most of it seemed very clean. I did find some things irritating though including the hairdryer and TV remote not working in my room. Most things weren't the effort to complain about as, from the 4th floor, you had to walk down steep flights of stairs (no lift) to get to reception. The breakfast was very basic and seemed to mainly be help-yourself in style. The staff did not go out of their way to help me when all I asked for was a cup of coffee. This was the same attitude on departure when noone even acknowledged me when I went to give in my key. Other gripes included a member of staff smoking in the dining area (now illegal!). Apart from that everything was fine!!!! Glad it was only one night. Such a shame that London hotels are so poor in service and quality compared to the rest of the country. What a bad impression they must give to overseas visitors. This could be a fantastic hotel and presumably a profitable business if the owners/managers just made a very few adjustments to their service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't panic!”
Reviews.Author: zurich67
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel and simply had to say something... I go to London once or twice every year and being on a very tight budget, I am forever searching for the ultimate deal in hotel rooms. In 15 years, the Royal Hyde Park was the best hotel my budget could buy in London. If you think you can find better for this kind of money, you are very wrong. I stayed for several nights last year and I had a private shower/bathroom, the room was clean, the staff was polite and attentive and I felt safe. These are in my opinion the basic requirements that budget hotels should meet and this one does. The room even had the bonus of tea & coffee making facilities and a tv. Plus the location is great if very noisy: close to Hyde park and all the basic shopping for regular visitors (M&S, Boots) on your doorstep. Lots of restaurants, and a shopping centre with a cinema complex inside. If you expect things like edible breakfast, rooms large enough to walk around the bed, bathrooms big enough for two people to stand in, quiet nights, American style service etc., then save up and go and pay for three stars upwards, as anything beneath will not ever provide what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Dream destination, (not)!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithasuitcase
Reviews.Content: The Royal Hyde Park Hotel is a dream destination if you have nightmares! Payment is requested before you even see the room which is probably just as well, as you would probably change your mind if you saw the room first. The very small twin room we had was grimy though the bed linen was clean. You had to walk sideways round the beds as there wasn't enough room to walk normally. There were a variety of broken light fixtures hanging from the wall but the bedside lights eventually were coaxed to perform. The shower was held up by a rubber band twisted round the water pipe and secured by a small pencil. The water control of the shower was faulty and when turned off switched itself back on, gradually increasing the water flow until it was fully on. The noisy hot water running in the bathroom lent the unpleasantly sweaty humidity of a sauna to the room. The process was repeated at regular intervals throughout the night! A complaint to the management simply brought someone who turned the shower off and therefore "fixed"it! The language barrier was a real problem in this situation. Breakfast was a croissant which was fine and weak coffee. Don't go there! There are much better places to be had for less money in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Sally28_7
Reviews.Content: Tiny room and en suite. Noisy at night and rude staff. Not to be recommended

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Hyde Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 106 / 110 Queensway, London W2 3RR, England
